articles.title: She’s running Boston to raise money for Homes For Our Troops
articles.description:
"I run for veterans who gave everything. I run for the courage it takes to start over. And I run because everyone deserves a home — and a life — that supports who they are now."

The post She’s running Boston to raise money for Homes For Our Troops appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Rebecca Ludwig is running the Boston Marathon to support Homes For Our Troops.
She aims to raise funds for veterans needing housing and support.
The initiative highlights the ongoing need for veteran assistance in Boston.

articles.title: Unheralded players who could make a big impact in the Super Bowl
articles.description:
From special team standouts to overlooked defenders, a handful of under-the-radar players could swing the Super Bowl outcome between the Patriots and Seahawks.

The post Unheralded players who could make a big impact in the Super Bowl appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Patriots face Seahawks in Super Bowl, highlighting potential game-changing under-the-radar players.
Special teams and overlooked defenders could significantly influence the game's outcome on February 3, 2026.
Boston fans should watch for unexpected contributions that may sway the championship result.

articles.title: Lawmakers urge Healey to  prepare for possible state prosecutions of federal officials
articles.description:
A group of state senators called on Gov. Maura Healey to create a "rapid response task force" that would respond to allegations of federal abuse.

The post Lawmakers urge Healey to prepare for possible state prosecutions of federal officials appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: State senators urged Gov. Maura Healey to form a rapid response task force.
Task force aims to address potential federal official misconduct allegations.
This initiative could lead to state-level prosecutions affecting Boston residents.

articles.title: Drake Maye’s shoulder injury improves ahead of Super Bowl showdown
articles.description:
“I threw a good bit," Maye said. "I threw as much as I would in a practice, and it felt great.”

The post Drake Maye’s shoulder injury improves ahead of Super Bowl showdown appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Drake Maye reports significant improvement in shoulder injury ahead of Super Bowl.
Maye practiced throwing extensively, indicating readiness for the February 12 game.
His recovery boosts the excitement for Boston fans anticipating the Super Bowl.

articles.title: She’s running Boston to honor her sister — and the hospital that treated her
articles.description:
"I'm so honored to carry her with me for every minute and mile of this race, in the city that we loved."

The post She’s running Boston to honor her sister — and the hospital that treated her appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Hannah Murray runs the Boston Marathon to honor her late sister.
She is raising funds for Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, supporting local cancer treatment.
The race symbolizes community support and remembrance for Boston residents.

articles.title: Advocates, officials welcome judge’s move to block end of protections for Haitian immigrants
articles.description:
"I felt happiness for the community because they were able to go to sleep last night — knowing that today, the world wasn’t going to be pulled from under them."

The post Advocates, officials welcome judge’s move to block end of protections for Haitian immigrants appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Judge blocks end of protections for Haitian immigrants, ensuring continued safety for Boston's community.
Advocates express relief, stating community can rest easy after the ruling on February 3, 2026.
Local officials emphasize the importance of these protections for over 50,000 Haitian residents in Boston.

articles.title: Jill Biden’s first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at their Delaware home
articles.description:
William Stevenson, 77, of Wilmington was married to Jill Biden from 1970 to 1975.

The post Jill Biden’s first husband charged with killing wife in domestic dispute at their Delaware home appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: William Stevenson, 77, charged with killing his wife in Delaware on February 3, 2026.
Stevenson was previously married to Jill Biden from 1970 to 1975.
This incident raises concerns about domestic violence awareness in the Boston community.

articles.title: What Robert Spillane and Harold Landry said about their injury statuses
articles.description:
Neither player practiced last week. Both said they are working on being able to play Sunday.

The post What Robert Spillane and Harold Landry said about their injury statuses appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Robert Spillane and Harold Landry missed practice last week due to injuries.
Both players are aiming to return for the Super Bowl on Sunday.
Their availability could significantly affect the Patriots' defensive strategy.
